mdRecord.dcterms:title: Russian and Belgian War Missions at Mount Vernon, June 24, 1917
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Washington, D.C. : Press of Judd & Detweiler, Inc., 1918
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Published image of the Russian and Belgian Missions visit to Mount Vernon. Taken from "Addresses at the Tomb of Washington by the Special Missions from France, England, Italy, Russia, Belgium, Japan, Serbia, 1917-1918," by Josephus Daniels. Seated, left to right, Miss Jane Riggs, a vice-regent of the District of Columbia for the Mount Vernon Ladies' Association; Miss Margaret Wilson, daughter of the President; Baron Moncheur, head of the Belgian mission; Secretary of State Robert Lansing; Boris Bakhmetieff, new Russian ambassador and head of the mission; Mrs. Josephus Daniels and Secretary Daniels. Standing, between Miss Wilson and Baron Moncheur, is Maj. Gen. Leclercq, and next to him in the row behind is Maj. Osterieth, of the Belgian mission. Next is Brig. Gen. Joseph E. Kuhn. Standing back of Secretary Lansing is Gen. Roop, of the Russian mission. The others are military or clerical attaches of the two missions.
